ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to someone else who is interested in Yoruba.
Fun class. Really familiarizes you with the Yoruba language and culture.
It's a continuation of the material from the L1 course.

It was an interesting class but the workload was tremendously hard. Homework assignments close to every day that take hours. A lot of audio recordings are due each week (this wasn't listed in the syllabus). On top of this the professor expects you to keep a journal and record everything you do every day and you have to write it all in Yoruba. Definitely one of the harder of not the hardest language at Yale. I wouldn't recommend anyone to take the class. I certainly will not be taking it next year
It's a good class if you're genuinely interested in learning the language and willing to put in the work.
A language class that meets every day. Expect to have to do a lot of work for it. Could be group work or individual homework.
